meanings.definition: The outer covering of an animal's body
meanings.sent1: The lion's skins protect it from the sun and rain.
meanings.sent2: The snake sheds its old skins as it grows.
meanings.sent3: The zebra's skins are like its own natural coat.
meanings.sent4: The skins of the armadillo are like a suit of armor.
meanings.sent5: The skins of the fish shimmer in the water.

meanings.definition: The outer layer of a fruit or vegetable
meanings.sent1: The apple's skins are rich in nutrients.
meanings.sent2: It's best to wash the skins of fruits before eating them.
meanings.sent3: The orange's skins can be used to make zest for baking.
meanings.sent4: The potato skins add flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent5: The skins of grapes can be tart or sweet.

meanings.definition: A thin layer of tissue covering the body or an organ
meanings.sent1: The delicate skins of the eyelids protect the eyes.
meanings.sent2: The skins of the onion can make you cry when cut.
meanings.sent3: The skins of the fingers are sensitive to touch.
meanings.sent4: The skins of the lungs help with breathing.
meanings.sent5: The skins of the brain are crucial for protection.

meanings.definition: A container made from animal skin
meanings.sent1: The tribal drum was covered in animal skins.
meanings.sent2: The ancient scroll was wrapped in delicate skins.
meanings.sent3: The water flask was crafted from sturdy skins.
meanings.sent4: The pouch was made from kangaroo skins.
meanings.sent5: The quiver was adorned with colorful skins.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a person's clothing or outfit
meanings.sent1: She always wears the latest trendy skins.
meanings.sent2: His casual skins consisted of jeans and a t-shirt.
meanings.sent3: The party required fancy skins for entry.
meanings.sent4: The detective's disguise was his secret skins.
meanings.sent5: Her performance outfit was made of shiny skins.
